note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
name: powerdelivery
tagline: A deployment framework helping you to continuously deliver software to your customers using Microsoft Team Foundation Server and Windows PowerShell.
body:
PowerDelivery is a deployment framework that helps you [continuously deliver](http://continuousdelivery.com/) software to your customers using [Microsoft Team Foundation Server](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vstudio/ff637362.aspx) and [Windows PowerShell](http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb978526.aspx).

## At a glance
* [Background of the project](https://github.com/eavonius/powerdelivery/wiki/Background)
* [Diagram of release workflow](https://github.com/eavonius/powerdelivery/wiki/Workflow-of-powerdelivery-releases)
* [Summary of continuous delivery](https://github.com/eavonius/powerdelivery/wiki/Summary-of-continuous-delivery) with powerdelivery
* [What's included](https://github.com/eavonius/powerdelivery/wiki/What%27s-Included)

## [Getting started](https://github.com/eavonius/powerdelivery/wiki/Getting-started)
Get powerdelivery, configure TFS, and run the [Add Pipeline utility](https://github.com/eavonius/powerdelivery/wiki/Adding-PowerDelivery-to-a-TFS-Project)

## [Writing builds](https://github.com/eavonius/powerdelivery/wiki/Writing-builds)
Learn how to write the simple PowerShell script that delivers your products.

## [Triggering builds](https://github.com/eavonius/powerdelivery/wiki/Triggering-builds)
How builds are run locally, or promoted through a delivery pipeline on Team Foundation Server.

### [PowerShell cmdlet reference](https://github.com/eavonius/powerdelivery/wiki/Powershell-cmdlet-reference)
Commands you can use in your PowerShell script.
